newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Avesta Sheffield says no deliveries stopped.
newsitem.headline: Avesta Sheffield says no deliveries stopped.

text.p: Swedish-British steel company Avesta Sheffield said on Friday no deliveries would be affected by the explosion overnight at a smelter at its Avesta, Sweden plant.

Peter Gossas, head of operations at the Avesta plant, told Reuters that warehouses stored two days worth of production and the company would not have to reinforce inventories with steel produced elsewhere.
"Return on capital employed will increase somewhat because of the reduced inventories," Gossas said.
"We plan to optimise inventories with traditional measures," Gossas said.
An explosion overnight at Swedish-British steel company Avesta Sheffield plant stopped production at a smelter after two or three tonnes of steel ran out onto a water pipe.
Avesta Sheffield spokesman Alf Wedmalm told Reuters repairs would take 24 hours and that the accident was minor. The company is 51 percent owned by British Steel.
